ARTICLE.TITLE: Business rates: Boris Johnson’s reshuffle ‘delays reform’
ARTICLE.TEXT:
The recent ministerial reshuffle has risked delaying urgent business rates reform, the British Retail Consortium and nine other trade bodies have complained.

In a letter to the Treasury select committee the groups urged MPs to publish the results of their business rates inquiry before the autumn budget. The committee began its inquiry in February, with its findings due to be published next month.

Four out of 12 committee members have left in the past month. Nicky Morgan, its chairwoman, joined the cabinet as culture secretary, Colin Clark and Simon Clarke became ministers and Charlie Elphicke, the MP for Dover, was removed after being charged with sexual assault last month.
